title: The Glory of the Śrī Chaitanya Sāraswat Maṭh
author: Composed by Śrīla B.R. Śrīdhar Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj while
residing in a hut on the banks of the Ganges in 1941.
Rendered into English by Śrīpād B.A. Sāgar Mahārāj from the Bengali translation by Śrīla B.S. Govinda Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj.

translation: In the Holy Abode of transcendental touchstone,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    Śrī Nabadwīp Dham—the selfsame Śrī Vṛndāvan,<br class="SongVerse__break" />in the land of Koladwīp, whose inner identity<br class="SongVerse__break" />    is the King of mountains Śrī Govardhan,<br class="SongVerse__break" />near the charming shores of the holy River Bhāgīrathī<br class="SongVerse__break" />    who delivers all the fallen souls,<br class="SongVerse__break" />stands that grand and glorious King of all Temples —<br class="SongVerse__break" />    Śrī Chaitanya Sāraswat Maṭh.

In that beautiful retreat, the surrendered devotees<br class="SongVerse__break" />    whose lives are the message of Śrī Gaura,<br class="SongVerse__break" />are eternally absorbed in the loving service<br class="SongVerse__break" />    of the Divine Master, the Golden Lord Gaurāṅga,<br class="SongVerse__break" />and the Loving Lord Śrī Govindasundar<br class="SongVerse__break" />    with His consort Śrīmatī Gāndharvā,<br class="SongVerse__break" />accompanied by all Their beloved associates.

With hearts always filled with good hope<br class="SongVerse__break" />        to attain the grace of the Lord,<br class="SongVerse__break" />following faithfully in the line<br class="SongVerse__break" />    of Śrī Śrī Rūpa and Raghunāth —<br class="SongVerse__break" />the storekeepers of the unlimited treasure<br class="SongVerse__break" />    of pure, sweet love divine —<br class="SongVerse__break" />those surrendered souls ever sing the unending glories<br class="SongVerse__break" />    of the transcendental name and qualities<br class="SongVerse__break" />of the most magnanimous, original Supreme Lord,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    Śrī Śrī Gaurāṅgasundar.

Indeed the hearts of all beings, moving and still,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    marvel in the glory of Śrī Chaitanya Sāraswat Maṭh<br class="SongVerse__break" />as they take shelter in the soothing, affectionate shade<br class="SongVerse__break" />    of the victory flag that flies aloft<br class="SongVerse__break" />and sings wholeheartedly to the world the ever-expanding<br class="SongVerse__break" />    renown of Śrī Chaitanya Sāraswat Maṭh;<br class="SongVerse__break" />bearing that banner of all transcendental benedictions,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    Śrī Chaitanya Sāraswat Maṭh ever shines resplendent<br class="SongVerse__break" />        in all its divine magnificence.
